trans-unit.source: Choosing a Type of Relay Authentication
trans-unit.target: Choosing a Type of Relay Authentication

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> enumeration is referenced by the security settings in all of the relay bindings.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> enumeration is referenced by the security settings in all of the relay bindings.

trans-unit.source: The use of this property is identical throughout all bindings.
trans-unit.target: The use of this property is identical throughout all bindings.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the possible values for this enumeration.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the possible values for this enumeration.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> value
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType</codeEntityReference> value

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The client is required to provide a relay access token to access the service endpoint, and access control is performed either by <token>sb2</token> (SAS) or the <token>ac1</token> service.
trans-unit.target: The client is required to provide a relay access token to access the service endpoint, and access control is performed either by <token>sb2</token> (SAS) or the <token>ac1</token> service.

trans-unit.source: If this option is set on the service binding, all clients must acquire and present tokens to <token>sb2</token> when establishing the channel.
trans-unit.target: If this option is set on the service binding, all clients must acquire and present tokens to <token>sb2</token> when establishing the channel.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, all subsequent access control is delegated to <token>ac2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Furthermore, all subsequent access control is delegated to <token>ac2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The relay access token may be a SAS, a shared secret, a simple Web access token, or a SAML token.
trans-unit.target: The relay access token may be a SAS, a shared secret, a simple Web access token, or a SAML token.

trans-unit.source: This is the default value.
trans-unit.target: This is the default value.

trans-unit.source: The client is not required to provide a relay access token.
trans-unit.target: The client is not required to provide a relay access token.

trans-unit.source: Services are not required to present access tokens at any time.
trans-unit.target: Services are not required to present access tokens at any time.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, this represents an opt-out mechanism with which services can waive the <token>ac2</token> protection on the endpoint and perform their own access control.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, this represents an opt-out mechanism with which services can waive the <token>ac2</token> protection on the endpoint and perform their own access control.

trans-unit.source: When the <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference> option is chosen, all access control management is delegated to the <token>ac2</token> service.
trans-unit.target: When the <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference> option is chosen, all access control management is delegated to the <token>ac2</token> service.

trans-unit.source: <token>ac2</token> yields an access control token for the relay that indicates whether the requestor can listen on or send to the relay (or both).
trans-unit.target: <token>ac2</token> yields an access control token for the relay that indicates whether the requestor can listen on or send to the relay (or both).

trans-unit.source: At the same time, it protects the actual identity of the caller.
trans-unit.target: At the same time, it protects the actual identity of the caller.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, the listening service will not be able to gather any user-specific information.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, the listening service will not be able to gather any user-specific information.

trans-unit.source: Effectively, the service operates in an anonymous authentication mode, trusting the <token>ac2</token> service.
trans-unit.target: Effectively, the service operates in an anonymous authentication mode, trusting the <token>ac2</token> service.

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference> option causes the relay to pass all incoming messages to the service.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference> option causes the relay to pass all incoming messages to the service.

trans-unit.source: The service assumes the responsibility for performing all access control locally, and also more precise access control.
trans-unit.target: The service assumes the responsibility for performing all access control locally, and also more precise access control.

trans-unit.source: The type of access control depends on business data, local credentials stores, or other criteria—but it potentially exposes the service to unwanted traffic.
trans-unit.target: The type of access control depends on business data, local credentials stores, or other criteria—but it potentially exposes the service to unwanted traffic.

trans-unit.source: The hybrid solution is to combine the <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference> option with end-to-end message security, which is an option supported by most bindings.
trans-unit.target: The hybrid solution is to combine the <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference> option with end-to-end message security, which is an option supported by most bindings.

trans-unit.source: In this combination, the client is required to provide two separate credentials: one via the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior</codeEntityReference> behavior, for gaining access to the service through <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this combination, the client is required to provide two separate credentials: one via the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TransportClientEndpointBehavior</codeEntityReference> behavior, for gaining access to the service through <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The latter is specified on the regular <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Configuration.TransportClientEndpointBehaviorElement.ClientCredentials</codeEntityReference> property of the channel factory, which is used to help secure the end-to-end communication path.
trans-unit.target: The latter is specified on the regular <codeEntityReference>P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Configuration.TransportClientEndpointBehaviorElement.ClientCredentials</codeEntityReference> property of the channel factory, which is used to help secure the end-to-end communication path.

trans-unit.source: The latter credential can be a token issued by <token>ac2</token> in the scope of the solution.
trans-unit.target: The latter credential can be a token issued by <token>ac2</token> in the scope of the solution.

trans-unit.source: You are required to use message-security for end-to-end authorization.
trans-unit.target: You are required to use message-security for end-to-end authorization.

trans-unit.source: This is because the <token>sb2</token> bindings do not support the use of standard <token>indigo2</token> transport-credentials.
trans-unit.target: This is because the <token>sb2</token> bindings do not support the use of standard <token>indigo2</token> transport-credentials.

trans-unit.source: For most uses, transport-credentials can only be passed point-to-point on a connection, and cannot traverse intermediaries such as <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: For most uses, transport-credentials can only be passed point-to-point on a connection, and cannot traverse intermediaries such as <token>sb2</token>.
